definition: male/staminate/grand/imposing/powerful/mighty/person or state having great power and influence
healthy/to invigorate/to strengthen/to be good at/to be strong in

sentences.english: She paints with bold strokes of the brush.
sentences.chinese: 她用雄健有力的笔触绘画。

sentences.english: We should brace up our virile and energetic spirit.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该拿出雄健的精神。

sentences.english: It ' s nothing but powerful spirit can conquer them.
sentences.chinese: 这是靠雄健的精神才能够冲过去的。

sentences.english: The single-arch flying Buttresses at the eastern end are notable for their Boldness and grace.
sentences.chinese: 东侧的单拱飞扶垛以雄健优雅着称。

sentences.english: In front of the Buddha are two mighty stone lions; on two sides are four followers.
sentences.chinese: 主尊前有两只姿态雄健的石狮，左右侍立侍从。

sentences.english: His dance movements are vigorous and graceful.
The dragon column on the 2nd floor is vigorous in posture, with smooth decorative outline.
sentences.chinese: 第二层之蟠龙柱，体态雄健，纹饰线条流畅。

sentences.english: We shall take on the tough spirits.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该拿出雄健的精神。

sentences.english: But this majestic interest cannot be felt by the people who doesn't have the powerful spirit.
sentences.chinese: 但这种壮美的趣味是非有雄健的精神的不能感觉到的。

sentences.english: True beauty in a towering mountain, vigorous, steep tall in two.
sentences.chinese: 真山之美，一在巍峨雄健，二在险峻挺拔。

definition: bold/upright and strong/vigorous/forceful (brush strokes)/sureness of touch
